intro: Lamium garganicum subsp. minus, commonly known as the lesser dead-nettle, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It typically grows to a height of about 20–40 centimeters and features heart-shaped, pubescent leaves with a reddish or purple underside. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are usually pink or purple, arranged in whorls along the stems. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland areas or along stream banks. Its flowers attract various pollinators, including bees and flies, contributing to its ecological significance.
